data.title: Classmates
data.solution:
numOfClasses = int(input())
totalNumOfClassmates = int(input())
sharedClassesCount = int(input())
numOfClassmates = [int(x) for x in input().split()]

classmates = {}
for i in range(numOfClasses):
    for name in input().split():
        if name not in classmates: classmates[name] = 1
        else: classmates[name] += 1

sharedClassmateList = list(filter(lambda x: classmates[x] >= sharedClassesCount, classmates.keys()))
print('NONE' if not sharedClassmateList else ' '.join(sharedClassmateList))
data.statement: You just signed up for this semester's classes, and you want to find students who share multiple classes with you. Given a class roster of [[N]] classes, determine the set of students who are in at least [[P]] of your classes. Assume that any class in this roster you are signed up for.

data.constraints: No class will contain duplicate names, e.g., a class roster of {{Joshua Kyle Joshua Bob}} is impossible.
data.stubGenerator:
read numOfClasses:int
read totalNumOfClassmates:int
read sharedClassesCount:int
loopline numOfClasses classSize:int
loop numOfClasses
    read classmateName:string(512)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of classes you are signed up for.
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[C]] representing how many students there are in total.
<<Line 3:>> An integer [[P]] representing how many classes you want to share with a student for them to count.
<<Line 4:>> Space-separated integers [[M]] representing the number of students in each class.

<<Next [[N]] lines:>> Space-separated strings representing names of students in each class.
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Strings of space-separated names of students who you share at least [[P]] classes with. If there are no students who you share [[P]] classes with, output {{NONE}}.

You should output the students in the order they appear in the roster. For example, if {{Joe Ann Bob}} are in your first class, and your second class has {{Bob Ann Kyle}}, with [[P]]=2, the appropriate output is {{Ann Bob}} since Ann appeared first.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You just signed up for this semester's classes, and you want to find students who share multiple classes with you. Given a class roster of N classes, determine the set of students who are in at least P of your classes. Assume that any class in this roster you are signed up for.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of classes you are signed up for.
Line 2: An integer C representing how many students there are in total.
Line 3: An integer P representing how many classes you want to share with a student for them to count.
Line 4: Space-separated integers M representing the number of students in each class.

Next N lines: Space-separated strings representing names of students in each class.
Output
Line 1: Strings of space-separated names of students who you share at least P classes with. If there are no students who you share P classes with, output NONE.

You should output the students in the order they appear in the roster. For example, if Joe Ann Bob are in your first class, and your second class has Bob Ann Kyle, with P=2, the appropriate output is Ann Bob since Ann appeared first.
Constraints
No class will contain duplicate names, e.g., a class roster of Joshua Kyle Joshua Bob is impossible.
Example
Input
5
25
2
6 4 5 7 3
Joseph Allen Mary Carol Doug Bob
Bob Marie Paul Joseph
Bob Joseph Allen Trevor Christopher
Billy Mary Lisa Larry Jonah Annemarie Cole
Stephanie Bob Kit
Output
Joseph Allen Mary Bob
